job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Storm Lake, IA
cons: Disconnected from main campus, lack of connection.

review_title: There is a better opportunity out there for you other than BVU
pros: Benefits are good, there is a match for retirement, athletes and students are nice, most workers are nice but there are quite a few lazy ones.
cons:
DO NOT WORK HERE!!! There is a lack of support from administration if you are a coach. If you do a good job there is no chance of getting a raise. There is a 1% or $1000 university wide raise most years but it’s not guaranteed. The housing market in storm lake is crazy. You will definitely need a two person income if you are a coach and want to buy a house. They will try to sell you on the lake that the university sits on but the lake has dumping from Tyson and has known to have fish herpes. 
The school will praise the amount of money they have in their endowment but do not pay the coaches very well. 65% of the students on campus are athletes. The endowment comes from athletics. Very little colored population in the school If you want a constant headache, lack of respect for trying to progress the university, no incentive to make more money, and a nasty smell coming from Tyson and the lake, then BVU is the place for you.

cons: Pay could be better and work from home should be an option

job_title: Security Officer in Storm Lake, IA
pros: Meet many people, know hours month in advance, and very straight forward job.
cons: Part-time gets no overtime, no holiday pay, and there is lots of drama one may have to respond to instead of "actual" calls.

pros: Everyone is so nice and we all work together well. Also, a lot of alumni work there, which it's nice to see them coming back. I am only a student, but  if I wanted to find a job in Western Iowa I would definitely go to BVU as a first choice. It's so diverse and I really cannot get over how friendly everyone is.
cons: A lot of alumni work there. There are quite a few people who did not get their undergraduate from BVU though and everyone still gets along. I have little complaints.

review_title: Great employer, great benefits, great co-workers!
pros:
The co-workers and environment at BVU make it feel like a home, full of family and friends. 
The benefits are great. 
Opportunity for promotion.
cons: This is a smaller institution in northwest Iowa. Those moving to the area may struggle to find activities within the community if they are more familiar with the hustle and bustle of a city.

review_title: A nice place to work; high turnover and burnout rates

pros: I really enjoyed the people I was working with and getting the chance to know them on a personal and professional level, great experience.
